content: Well, the Democratic Party did get its start with Jefferson and the Anti-Federalists, and their continual effort to un-hinge the Constitution. It rooted itself in the Planteraucracy and pro-slavery of the South which was extremely expansionist, for need of new country as tobacco and cotton wore out the land - which caused both Indian Removal and intolerance of discussion of slavery, causing the Civil War - and the mess of Recontruction . .. . At least until his death, ole Grigdby could make a pretty good argument for his Epitaph - - Wandering and Wondering

At least until his death, ole Grigdby could make a pretty good argument for his Epitaph - - Wandering and Wondering

content: Even in the 1800's they knew a rotten apple when they saw it. That's nor a true statement though. The democratic party used to be the political party of the common working people. Back in the 1960's they started changing. I believe that they were starting to be taken over by the hippies. Then they lost touch with the common people and the professors in the colleges started teaching that the government owes everything to everyone just send in your taxes and the government will take care of you. And that leads us to today. Look at what our government is doing. Taking over the car companies, the banks and the financial markets.

content: Definitely agree with that. Virtually every World War II Veteran and Worker I knew in the 1950-60 was a Democrat. Only the rich people and upper management were Republicans. As a kid, I said "I like Ike!" and nearly got my mouth washed out with soap!! Couldn't figure it, because Eisenhower had been a great General. To Dad, he was just another Rich Republican trying to line his and the rich bankers pockets with workers' efforts and taxes - Maybe he was right - - But then along came war protests, abortion, drugs, etc etc etc and the Democratic Party went off courting the fanatical fringe - Dad never voted for a Republican in his life since he turned 21 in 1929 (he died in '82), and I've never voted for a Democrat since I turned 21 in 1971 - So it goes - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Definitely agree with that. Virtually every World War II Veteran and Worker I knew in the 1950-60 was a Democrat. Only the rich people and upper management were Republicans. As a kid, I said "I like Ike!" and nearly got my mouth washed out with soap!! Couldn't figure it, because Eisenhower had been a great General. content: Hopefully the republicans can reorganize and become a party that the people can believe in. It certainly isn't anything to speak of today.I just can't predict what will become of the USA if we keep going down the same path that we are following. The government cannot keep spending our kids and grandkids future like this administration is doing. But with no leadership in the GOP what can the conservatives do? We are out numbered and many, like in my state, have only demorats as senators. This is supposed to be a representative nation but my ideas and needs are not being met because we have no GOP senators to represent me and others like me.

content: Oop! Here we go, hair-splitting time again... Actually, Democracy is the perfect form of government, if all the people are highly educated, informed, dedicated to right living, and more worried about the betterment and continuation of their society, families and culture, than their own petty wants and needs - - However, Representative government will suffice if only part of the population is well educated, and the rest of society can be satisfied with that educated elite running the country. Of course, that still depends heavily on both groups being dedicated to right living, and more worried about the betterment and continuation of their society, families and culture, than their own petty wants and needs - - If a society, no matter what its education and informed status, is rife with dedication to selfish, defiant and lawless behavior - no form of government, no matter how noble or well intended, can save it from itself and its own self-destructive behavior - and it will kill itself from within...then being weak, it will be wiped out from without - - History teaches that again and again and.. . . . Wandering and Wondering
reply: Oop! Here we go, hair-splitting time again... Actually, Democracy is the perfect form of government, if all the people are highly educated, informed, dedicated to right living, and more worried about the betterment and continuation of their society, families and culture, than their own petty wants and needs - - However, Representative government will suffice if only part of the population is well educated, and the rest of society can be satisfied with that educated elite running the country. Of course, that still depends heavily on both groups being dedicated to right living, and more worried about the betterment and continuation of their society, families and culture, than their own petty wants and needs - - If a society, no matter what its education and informed status, is rife with dedication to selfish, defiant and lawless behavior - no form of government, no matter how noble or well intended, can save it from itself and its own self-destructive behavior - and it will kill itself from within...then being weak, it will be wiped out from without - - History teaches that again and again and.. . . . Wandering and Wondering
title: The Tombstone of TRUTH

content: quote: Actually, Democracy is the perfect form of government, if all the people are highly educated, informed, dedicated to right living, and more worried about the betterment and continuation of their society, families and culture, than their own petty wants and needs - - But that is an unattainable ideal scenario. Men who hold power will always use that power to create a rule of men instead of the rule of law. And the masses will always desire for this democratic gov't to benefit ourselves even if it enslaves others. We people have a strange way to justify all, as long as the truths of our actions are balanced with some good, ie. welfare. it's best to define strictly the role of those in power, and deal with social issues at a community level with strict constraints, such as our constitution (Bill of Rights) allows.
quote: Actually, Democracy is the perfect form of government, if all the people are highly educated, informed, dedicated to right living, and more worried about the betterment and continuation of their society, families and culture, than their own petty wants and needs - -
reply: But that is an unattainable ideal scenario. Men who hold power will always use that power to create a rule of men instead of the rule of law. And the masses will always desire for this democratic gov't to benefit ourselves even if it enslaves others. We people have a strange way to justify all, as long as the truths of our actions are balanced with some good, ie. welfare. it's best to define strictly the role of those in power, and deal with social issues at a community level with strict constraints, such as our constitution (Bill of Rights) allows.
title: The Tombstone of TRUTH
